positive.review: There isn't a tabletop game you cannot play on this. Magic, Warhammer, Trench Crusade, D&D, Yu-Gi-Oh, Risk, all of it is possible with this.

I kind of hate most tabletop games, and the UI/controls for this game are a pretty unintuitive, even if they do work well once you learn them. 

That being said, the amount of community content for this game is out of this world. Pretty much any board game you can think of has been ported to Tabletop Sim, and most of them are free community mods. If you want to play any tabletop game with your friends who may not live near you (or who may have impairments that makes it hard to do in-person tabletop sessions), this is your game. Also, if you want to prototype your own board game/card game/tabletop game, Tabletop Sim has easy to understand tools which will enable you to create basically anything you can imagine, and even has scripting tools which you can use to create rule simulations if you need to.

I was a hater for a long time, but honestly considering what you actually get from this game, it's hard to [i]truly[/i] hate it.
Would play it 1000 hours again for 100% Achievments! (Spoiler, the 1k hours was not the Last Achievment I got ^^')
This is a great application. Good for fun. Good for laughs. Good for family. Good for friends.
i mean its a tabletop simulator its useful you can play dnd and tabletops and it has good controls though its hard to import music or images or models
It simulates tabletops better than I could've expected. Easy to recommend.

This has been a LIFESAVER when trying out new board game ideas I have. The object choices are diverse, the table variety is great, and the custom components come out fantastic! I also love browsing through the workshop every once and awhile and checking out other games people have made through this. All in all, this is an amazing workshop for board game designers or if you just want to check out custom games, I would recommend this highly if you are either (or both) of those. 12/10

I've said it before and I'll say it a million time more, this is the best game that money can buy. You can download just about any existing board game or self made board game - FOR. FREE. You can have game nights with your friends wherever they may be and best of all you can make and play test your own board games to share with the world.

Petition to ban the king from chess

I'm not sure why the king is even in chess. Take a moment to think about it. This pathetic excuse of a piece waddles around the board like it's trying to find its glasses at 3AM. One square at a time? We have got queens moving around the board like hot knives through butter, bishops pulling off long-range diagonals like snipers in a stealth op, knights doing parkour, and then... there's the king. The royal potato. The supposed "most important piece" in the entire game, and yet it moves like it's late for bingo night and forgot its cane.

How does that even make sense??? The fate of the entire game rests in the hands of this trembling piece who couldn't fight his way out of a paper bag. Everyone else is out here doing tactical sacrifices, forks, pins, brilliant plays, and the king just chills there in the corner like â€œI sure hope nobody notices me ðŸ¥ºðŸ‘‰ðŸ‘ˆ.â€ You'd think someone so important would at least know how to defend himself, but nope. One square. No diagonal hops. No teleports. No fireballs. Not even a stern look. Just that sad little shuffle like he's trying to avoid stepping on legos in the dark.

Youâ€™re telling me the King! the sovereign, the ruler, the big cheese, the important cucumber can be checkmated by a literal pawn that made it to the other side and got an upgrade? This is like watching a CEO get overthrown by an unpaid intern who showed up to the meeting with a better slideshow. It's embarrassing. Heâ€™s supposed to be royalty, not royalty-free. And donâ€™t even get me started on castling. Oh wow, congrats! You moved TWO squares like a big boy! What a game-changing mechanic! Wow! Incredible! Revolutionary! Bro, the rook literally carries the king like itâ€™s babysitting a toddler on a leash.

And the worst part? If the king dies, the game ends. Thatâ€™s it. All the drama. All the strategies. All the sacrifices. All of it thrown away because Grandpa Royal decided to stroll into check like he was going out for milk and forgot thereâ€™s a war going on. Itâ€™s not even funny anymore. Itâ€™s tragic. A disgrace. Why not just replace the king with a rubber duck at this point? At least that would be honest, and it could quack atleast.

So yeah. I'm not sure why the king is even in chess. It's SO useless. It canâ€™t even do anything. It's like playing tag, but one kid is wearing a crown and if you even look at him too long, the entire playground explodes, recess is canceled forever, and the principal calls your parents to tell them you lost at life. The king is the human equivalent of lag. Itâ€™s not just useless, it actively drags the game down.

Unbeatable tabletop experience! Love playing magic the gathering, warhammer, or practically every semi-famous board ever made, at no extra cost? Just pick up tabletop sim for like Â£5 and ur set
10/10
Awesome platform to play your favourite board games with friends who are far away. Quality of games depends on how well they were implemented by the community, but for the most part it's good enough.
Good. Much fun with friends. Stardew Valley Board game and Final destination are great. Also great for mtg
I like the many varieties of board games in the workshop, and how you can actually play board games online with ease.
Great platform for anyone who wants to enjoy tabletop and board games with friends, even long-distance. Iâ€™ve had a lot of fun playing Arkham Horror, Descent, Dune, and more.
regret not setting this up sooner, smooth, responsive UI, clever features. Experience has been nothing but positive.

Tabletop Simulator is pretty much an established staple of gaming today, a popular bridge between video gaming and board gaming.
So long as you understand english, you'll be able to play almost any game in existence - the workshop community is wild, whether it is to recreate real life games and their expensions, or to make their actual custom content for existing games! (just look at the amount of community content created around the Pokemon Master Trainer game, it's insane... Or speaking of insane, Insane Monopoly which nobody in their right mind would play.) Not that it's not a thing irl, but TTS makes it quite easy. A bit of graphical skills, a few models perhaps, an idea in mind and you can create your own board game prototype virtually.
Now it doesn't recreate 100% of the the fun of playing board games with friends, but it is close enough. And it mostly does spare the task of setting up the game... and mostly, of putting it away, the one most painful of things about board game. Also, you're free of cats potentially invading the game table or the boxes (unless there's a mod for that...?)
Now one may be concerned about this game's impact on actual board game sales - in fact there were a few cases of games published by the community having been taken down from the workshop. These are rare instances though, and I will say that I have bought many board games in material format [b]after[/b] trying them on TTS and being pleased with them (Such as Nemesis, Massive Darkness 2, DMC Bloody Palace and others). For people who do real life board gaming, it can indeed serve as a test software, so that you know if that board game you've seen in your local shop will be worth the investment for you and your friends.

Basically, if you have any enjoyment for tabletop games, even mild, there's no reason to not get Tabletop Simulator during a sale. One day or another, you'll be happy you grabbed it!
As someone who's studying board games, this is a fantastic way to play lotsa great stuff without the hassle of buying them!
Very good game to distract me from programming useful applications.
This lets you play other real world board games. Great for testing games before you buy or play ones you can't find/afford.
Perfect for game designers that want to see (and test) their ideas online, you can simulate every aspect of your product before building and selling.
0/10 chrashed a 5 player MTG commander game with only around 20 drawings of various TADC characters
Perfect for playing expensive table top games without selling your kidney.
Fantastic tool for playing board games online and as a playground for making and testing your own.
You can play almost any board or card game through the steam workshop. Great to play usually expensive card games like Magic the Gathering.

I only play this game for the warhammer 40k mod, which i will add works amazingly. I cannot recommend this game enough if you want to play 40k online, or even just to make different armys and practice them, the possibilities are quite endless and the best part it doesnt cost you money to try things out. 
Its really useful for trying expensive models in gameplay before you commit to buying them in real life. Its very fun game and has so many quality of life features that make playing 40k a lot quicker and easier but definitly shouldnt be used to substitute the real game. 
Its also very easy to make your own custom mods for the game like datacards or codexes, or any kind of text or data document you want really, you literally just need a PDF image and you can upload it to a custom template then save it, posting social media is probably harder!
The amount of different map packs the community has made is unreal, it would cost you a lot of money to play on some of the map designs i have seen in the game.
The whole experience is basically your warhammer 40k dream with no financial constraints, you're free to make the biggest most expensive army you can and play it for free.
If you like 40k this game is a no brainer like why do you not own it already?

Tabletop Simulator is incredibly versatile, allowing you to play hundreds if not thousands of different games and various game types.  For the cost of it's price tag, it is well worth the time and effort put into it.
Great. I love to be able to move the pieces myself, rather than just clicking buttons.
This is my positive review for Tabletop Simulator. I have fun playing this game, especially with friends. Chungus Odyssey is a game for the whole family!
The only real downside to this game is that I can't possibly make enough time to try all the boardgames the community keeps adding.

This is the perfect game to play with friends, learn boardgames before actually playing in person and the workshop is INSANE for the amount of content. 

Just have to actually find a friend for all of that.

One of my first PC games and still the one I play the most. I've put hours into a lot of titles, but I always return to this one. Itâ€™s basically every tabletop game you could ever want to play, all in one package.
Does what it says on the tin, albiet there can be connection problems over especially long distances

Been playing TTS for years. 100% for dnd. The community content really adds value to the game. I love that I can import my hero forge minis into the program. 800+ hours in game as the DM playing, making maps, and encounters has kept all of us entertained. The only downside is that some community content stops working depending on where they've linked their content. Sure you have a cache that stores some files, but when another player joins in and that content is unavailible, they cannot see it. If only you could share your screen and have a program that also showed you as the DM in a corner. Maybe it would work with discord and OBS.....
Best virtual tabletop tool I've used. Very complex, with full scripting for the eggheads out there. A must-have for any avid board game lover without a solid, dedicated online program.
Best game to play literally anything tabletop. Testing board games, playing magic or other card games. Its got a learning curve, but so so worth it.
i get to play games with my friends like Pandemic Legacy Season 1. and Pandemic Legacy Season 2. and Pandemic Legacy Season 0. and-
Not much to be said. Its a good sandbox for playing with friends. Excellent if you are looking to play test a card/board game you are developing

One of the best â€œgamesâ€ on Steam!
I live far away from my brother/family and most friends, so this is how we can easily play our favorite board/card games together!

In the workshop you can find amazing (and scripted) versions of most of your favorite board/card games!
Totally worth it (even if not on sale)!

Also, there is a button that allows you to â€œflipâ€ the table. What else can you want?!
Big chungus is a really funny meme trust it's like so peak I could scream and shit myself chat
What a fantastic way to connect/reconnect with friends that now live far away.
lots of fun with friends. Although alot of the workshop stuff can take up alot of space and be glitchy.
Great boardgame simulator. Community creates a thousands of free games you can use and play with your friends. Every board game fans should try this. 12 table flips of 10!
it makes it easier to play games with friends. I love the variety of things and creativity on here

I maybe spent a bit too much time in this game but it's also a testament to how much this game has to offer. Any board or card game that you can think of probably has a way to play it on tabletop simulator. The graphics aren't too crazy which is nice as even your gran's computer could probably run it. I would highly suggest this game to anyone who has even a passing interest in tabletop games as you will definitely get your money's worth. Only big downside I would say is that some of the physics can be sort of wonky like the dice rolling and putting stuff on cards but ultimately none of it will really ruin your play experience. Highly Recommended.
A work of magic, brings the joys of tabletop gaming to my desktop
I was able to play with a very expensive Magic the Gathering commander deck and beat my friends, so it's definitely worth it.
Think of any board game and it will be there as a free mod. Amazing community work.
its a really great way to hang out with your friends and play games. It's great that there's such a good workshop where you can add soo many more games that keeps it fresh

This is such a ubiquitous program I highly recommend everyone gets it.  You can find any board or card game you can think of, up to and including D&D and Warhammer in the workshop.  Putting TTS in your checkout should be one of the first things anyone does on Steam.

if you are planning on trying to play warhammer 40k with it just before buying make sure that you 100% SURE HOW TO PLAY AND HOW TO SET IT UP , i had to refund this game sadly because i didnt know what to do

Card Games, Tabletop, 3D D&D, WH40K and More, There's a lot to find if you have friends, or friends to find if you don't. Not the most octane of games, But it brings people together, or something like that.

Is it a game? no.
This is a really neat way of playing board games on your computer with friends, or, in my case, test out games I want to buy.
This is a great tool for playing games remotely with friends, and also for trying out new games before purchasing.
It's just a good deal. All the board games you can want, online, for $26 CAD, plus official and unofficial expansions made by the community.
This game is worth $20 just for the Warhammer workshop content alone, no need to go into generational debt over some plastic space dudes.
Simulates the tops of tables fairly well, but for some reason everyone uses it to simulate board games instead

I could make a digital version of a very old board game that is out of print and known by friends who live far away. Had to recreate the assets via external design software, but then it was super easy. Haven't tried with pictures but I guess it would have worked just fine. Among the other things, I love that you you can easily add snap points. For all board game lovers, it is the closest to the real experience when there is no option of meeting in person. Just buy it. Make sure you have enough hardware to run it smoothly though.
A good game for playing with long distance friends or family with a familiar backdrop of tabletop games! 10/10
If you play tabletop miniatures games and want to play online, this game is insane value, but I'd ditch it in a heartbeat for a competitor that was less clunky.

Load up, 
Try to make a lobby,
Fail,
Retry,
Fail,
Join a public lobby,
Have fun for and hour or 2,
Get addicted to this game,
Continue playing for another 8 hours and more.
What can I say.. game changer app for Magic (in my case) soon to try other games.
I have been able to play lots of board and card games with family and friends. It takes a fair bit of computing resource to run and the interface is a bit tricky and sometimes fiddly.

After a little setup and mod installs this game works like a charm. Had a full length Warhammer 40k game with a friend and it was fantastic. As close as you can get to virtual Warhammer. Game runs really smooth and I am sure the possibilities are endless with what games you can actually replicate. 100 percent recommend trying.
In short, it does exactly what it is supposed to do, and it does it well.

Best Kept Secre...shhh on Steam......just try it! It's amazing! Oh and don't forget the workshops community mods under table top simulator they are probably better than most the official ones. The fans are unreal smart little buggers. Great way to play with your friends from around the world, easy to save and play later, no need to set up and store giant table anywhere. No subscription models, no need for everyone to have all the mods, just the host. Best tabletop online system out there. If you get it don't forget to get tts vault  from gethub or https://www.nexusmods.com/tabletopsimulator/mods/426?tab=description to save your complete favorites offline just in case the links ever break *shoutout to angelo for making the vault*  :)
real solid sandbox for playing just about any board/card/table top game due to mod support being amazing.

After 3000 hours I still only have played one game on this godforsaken dumpster fire of a game hub but It is still a realy good game if you can handle the bullshit that is the UI.  I would recomend this game to people who play a tabletop game that is either to expensive to get into for yourselfe or If there are not enough people around to play it with and I would also highly recomend you join a community if you plan on playing a specific typ of Tabletop game.

Endless possibilities. The sheer amount of what you can find for assets, for game and for general entertainment is phenomenal. With a community of dedicated and and game loving folks the sheer number of games to play, ways to play them and how much content is out there is astonishing. 
Highly recommended to anyone who likes to play board game, card games, party games and other similar style game but doesn't always have the luxury of being physically with people.

likes: can play some classic board and card games

dislikes: the community can be pretty.....meh. to say the least.

Think of it like this: You're paying the 15 dollar price point in order to have workshop access to basically any tabletop game under the sun, including some TCGs. It's the most worthwhile purchase for anyone who's ever had any kind of interest in tabletop games. And if you have VR, I bet this goes from amazing to fucking mindblowing. 1000000% recommend!!
great tables to be experienced here. delivers its promise to be a table simulator. good tables + good vibes = good review. get the table game. some may say it competes with the real deal. table
Great for playing board games with other friends who are geographically impaired!
It simulates the table top, what can I say. Lots of customization options available and it's a bunch of fun to make your own virtual tabletop games.
A little glitchy at times, but an absolutely fantastic simulator for basically any tabletop game.  Add -nointro to launch options to get rid of the weird splorch sound when you boot the game.
you get basically get every board game you want plus even unique ones you didn't know you wanted for the price of one game thanks to the talented community!
If you like board games get this, if it exists as a board game its in this games workshop. Absolutely amazing.

As a father of a toddler and a frequent traveler for work, Tabletop Simulator (TTS) is virtually the only possible way I can enjoy board gaming with any regularity.  Save states and scripting make playing most games a breeze!  I vastly prefer it TTS over its competition (Tabletopia/Tabletop Playground).

Also, the main menu theme never fails to bring my mood up, regardless of how the day has gone.

Tts takes some getting used to, but once you play a game or two, its excellent. You can play pretty much any table top game with the help of the steam workshop, and its fantastic. 100% recommend for table top fans, or magic the gathering players. If you have no friends like me, there are great discord communitys hosting games all times of day and night, all over the world.
Game offers literally everything. I wish this was the game of choice for my friends. Maybe one day.

Great co-op game to play with friends from afar!
It's good.


ps; it is really good

it works well and the modding community is stellar. Good stuff.
Works great for running mtg games if you find the right mods (10 minute search AND set up - easy as) 

absolute tabletop  |_{-_-}_|
Very flexible for many different types of Games.  But some commands are limited and not intuitive.
You can upload your own Table Top games into the game and that's pretty dope
Best mod for playing and playtesting board games
With a workshop item I can learn to play warhammer without having to go into debt i def reccomend
Really great platform for building and playing games.
Your mileage will vary depending on the quality of the mods you're using, but the good mods are outstanding, and the versatility of the framework alone makes this a must-buy.
We enjoy playing Settlers of Catan. Now that I've got a newer computer, things work really smoothly.
It's like a table, but you can put whatever you want on it! Play tons of boardgames, read a book, etc!
pretty good except i feel like it would crash my pc if i spam anything but i think thats more of a my pc issue
I'm pretty sure if I tried hard enough, I could mod Tabletop Simulator into Tabletop Simulator, and play Poker inside that Tabletop Simulation.
great game very fun to play with friends and family
Campaign for North Africa players rise up
fun :) i like playing mtg and being able to try new decks without spending money! good way to try new things and play with my long distance buddies.
A fantastic software where you can make whatever you like and play your favourite board games

PROS:
Tons of games to chose from
You can play with friends around the world

CONS:
It's hard to decide what to play because of too many choices
Friends not included
A must have for big gaming groups! If you're my friend I will pester you to get this game.
connected with my brother who lives in a different country and relived childhood days
I don't understand how this thing works but I'm grateful for it and love it
I love flipping my friends' tables in this game. Especially one friend, you know who you are :)

negative.review: What have you done with your update, guys? The game is no longer playable. When I click on Create --> Singleplayer or Multiplayer, the button gives feedback, but nothing opens. I can only look at the main menu!

I bought four copies of this game to play with relatives who live across the country, based on recommendations from others. Unfortunately, I do not recommend this game. The controls are unintuitive and difficult to explain, which made it challenging for everyone to get started. I spent hours trying to help others understand how everything works. This issue may be related to the paid DLC I purchased, but regardless, the experience was not enjoyable for me. Improvements to the controls or better tutorials would make the game more accessible.

Game runs like shit and consistently makes people reload and stops people from interacting with the board at all. Also when I tried to join my friends game it would only allow me to join as a spectator and not let me play the game at all. absolute garbage would not ever recommend.
Doesn't work.  Can't do anything, gives option to create a server or join a server- decorative buttons.  Waste of money.
no singleplayer on simulated version of windows
they really need to fix the p2p issues that have been cropping up for the past few YEARS
spent 6 hours in one game do not buy this
this game sucks
bad game
Controller doesnâ€™t work
table slop simulator
Horrible
I've spent more times trying to get assets to download than actually playing anything.

It worked great for the longest time, then one day and since, it takes forever to launch the game, and most of the assets stopped loading. I only use this game for D&D and Red Dragon Inn, so I can always use something else to make D&D maps.
